intro: Heracleum austriacum subsp. austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian cow parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants with characteristic umbel-shaped flowers. The plant features hollow, ridged stems and large, fern-like leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and appear in umbrella-like clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
